word_mean: 英两，：英国常衡制和药剂衡量制中的重量单位，缩写为oz.。英制1等于1磅的1／16，或者等于437.5喱(28.3495克)。药剂衡量制1等于1磅的1／12，或480喱(31.103克)

derivation.yuyuan_name: Middle English: from Old French unce, from Latin uncia 'twelfth part (of a pound or foot'); compare with inch
Middle English: from Old French once, earlier lonce (the l- being misinterpreted as the definite article), based on Latin lynx, lync- (see lynx)

entry.tran: 盎司（英国和美国的重量单位，1磅合16盎司，1盎司等于28.35克）
entry.def: An ounce is a unit of weight used in Britain and the USA. There are sixteen ounces in a pound and one ounce is equal to 28.35 grams.
You can refer to a very small amount of something, such as a quality or characteristic, as an ounce .

example.ex: If only my father had possessed an ounce of business sense...
example.tran: 要是我父亲有一点点经商的头脑就好了。

example.ex: I spent every ounce of energy trying to hide.

means.word_mean: 1. a unit of apothecary weight equal to 480 grains or one twelfth of a pound
2. a unit of weight equal to one sixteenth of a pound or 16 drams or 28.349 grams
3. large feline of upland central Asia having long thick whitish fur
